rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;2f91fb68.1503b">   <title>AAA 2015 Call for Papers: Document-ing Power in an Age of Accountability </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;2f91fb68.1503b</link>   <description> Call for Papers, AAA 2015: Document-ing Power in an Age of Accountability<br><br>Organizer: Kathleen Inglis, PhD Candidate, Anthropology, Simon Fraser University<br><br>Studies in institutional ethnography, science and technology, and literacy have taught us that texts (including their material forms) play a central role in the cultural and institutional deployment of governance. In a neoliberal world increasingly preoccupied with accountability\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdis this policy working? Is this procedure profitable? Is this program on-course? Are these people performing well? How can this technique be more efficient?\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdtexts have become progressively crucial to regulation. Their increasing use is also due to recent technological developments which have [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T02:51:16-07:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Kathleen Inglis</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;2f91fb68.1503b</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;186bf751.1503b">   <title>a 5 minute survey </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;186bf751.1503b</link>   <description> Folks--<br>Gabriella Rundblad, of friend of mine in England, asked if I could<br>help her find people in the US to do the following. Perhaps some of you<br>might be able to help her find respondents--either by passing it on to<br>appropriate respondents or by contacting her (at &quot;Rundblad, Gabriella&quot;<br>&lt;gabriella.rundblad@kcl.ac.uk&gt; ) with suggestions ?<br>Thanks much,<br>David [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T06:07:01-07:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>David Kronenfeld</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;186bf751.1503b</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;75d92974.1503b">   <title>Re: Business Meeting, Pittsburgh </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;75d92974.1503b</link>   <description> I'll be there.<br><br>On Tue, Mar 10, 2015 at 2:58 PM, Ben Blount &lt;ben.blount23@gmail.com&gt; wrote:<br><br>&gt; Hello,<br>&gt;<br>&gt; The SASci Business meeting at the SfAA meeting in Pittsburgh is scheduled<br>&gt; for Friday, March 27th, in room Carnegie 1., 12:00-1:20. If you plan to be<br>&gt; at the SfAA meetings, please attend the SASci Business Meeting if possible.<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Thanks for your interest and cooperation.<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Best wiehs,<br>&gt; Ben<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Ben G. Blount, PhD<br>&gt; Social &amp; Ecological Informatics<br>&gt; President, Society for Anthropological Sciences<br>&gt; Chief Associate Editor, MAST<br>&gt; 13239 Spring Run<br>> [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T19:17:16-04:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Michael Thomas</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;75d92974.1503b</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;9a815810.1503b">   <title>Student Paper Prizes in the SASci meetings in Pittsburgh </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;9a815810.1503b</link>   <description> Dear All,<br>As we approach the meetings in Pittsburgh, I\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdd like to invite any students who have are going to present a paper or a poster to consider submitting these in advance for consideration for one of the SASci Student Paper/Poster prizes.<br><br>Please email the full paper or the poster (preferably PDF and not enormous in size\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd you can take a chance on PPT but these often look different on different machines). I\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdll distribute these round the panel and we will announce the winners at the meetings. There will, as usual, be a first prize ($400) and up to 3 [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T19:20:06+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>LYON S.M.</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;9a815810.1503b</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;c2b75017.1503b">   <title>Business Meeting, Pittsburgh </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;c2b75017.1503b</link>   <description> Hello,<br><br>The SASci Business meeting at the SfAA meeting in Pittsburgh is scheduled<br>for Friday, March 27th, in room Carnegie 1., 12:00-1:20. If you plan to be<br>at the SfAA meetings, please attend the SASci Business Meeting if possible.<br><br>Thanks for your interest and cooperation.<br><br>Best wiehs,<br>Ben<br><br>Ben G. Blount, PhD<br>Social &amp; Ecological Informatics<br>President, Society for Anthropological Sciences<br>Chief Associate Editor, MAST<br>13239 Spring Run<br>Helotes, TX 78023<br>ben.blount23@gmail.com<br>210-627-3265<br>www.benblountinformatics.com [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T13:58:59-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ben Blount</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;c2b75017.1503b</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;5a1002a3.1503b">   <title>Re: FINAL DRAFT of IWG-OSS Social Indicators Report for REVIEW: Comments Due COB March 27 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;5a1002a3.1503b</link>   <description> Apparently there is no official public comment, but I was told if you feel<br>strongly that you would like to comment then you should email me. I will<br>send a copy individually. Comments should be returned to me to be compiled<br>and submitted.<br><br>Trish<br><br>On Wednesday, March 4, 2015, Patricia Clay - NOAA Federal &lt;<br>patricia.m.clay@noaa.gov&gt; wrote: [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T08:12:14-04:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Patricia Clay - NOAA Federal</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;5a1002a3.1503b</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;4c0b31b6.1503a">   <title>AAA Community Engagement Grants </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;4c0b31b6.1503a</link>   <description> Hello,<br><br>If anyone has an interest in pursuing this grant opportunity, please let me<br>know.<br><br>Ben<br><br>2015 CALL FOR PROPOSALS<br><br>AAA COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT GRANTS<br><br>[cid:image002.jpg@01D05805.F7C04C80]<br>photo courtesy of Ethnographic Terminalia 2013: Exhibition as Residency<br><br>AAA Community Engagement Grants provide up to $2,000 for AAA sections to<br>rent offsite space in the annual meeting host city for events that engage<br>communities and extend Anthropology's reach beyond the annual meeting.<br>There are no restrictions on the kinds of events that may be proposed, but<br>the funds must be used only for rental of space, and the event must be open<br>to all [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-06T12:44:11-06:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ben Blount</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;4c0b31b6.1503a</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;dbe866d5.1503a">   <title>Summer Field School in Ethnographic Methods in New York City </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;dbe866d5.1503a</link>   <description> *Still a few places available. Apologies for cross posting. Please forward<br>to interested parties.*<br><br>7th CIFAS Field School in Ethnographic Research Methods<br><br>*Summer Field School in Ethnographic Methods in New York City*<br><br>*7th CIFAS Field School in Ethnographic Research Methods*<br><br>*June 15 to 26, 2015*<br><br>The Comitas Institute for Anthropological Study (CIFAS) is pleased to<br>announce the 7th CIFAS Field School in Ethnographic Research Methods, in<br>New York City [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-04T14:53:14-03:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Renzo Taddei</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;dbe866d5.1503a</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;50239eb1.1503a">   <title>Re: FINAL DRAFT of IWG-OSS Social Indicators Report for REVIEW: Comments Due COB March 27 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;50239eb1.1503a</link>   <description> Never mind. Not quite ready for prime time. Apologies! Thanks lucky stars<br>the list strips attachments... Reminds self to read more carefully before<br>forwarding.<br><br>I'll send again when it's out for public review and there's a link to<br>follow.<br><br>Trish<br><br>On Wed, Mar 4, 2015 at 3:59 PM, Patricia Clay - NOAA Federal &lt;<br>patricia.m.clay@noaa.gov&gt; wrote:<br><br>&gt; FYI, Trish Clay<br>&gt;<br>&gt; ---------- Forwarded message ----------<br>&gt; From: Roger Griffis - NOAA Federal &lt;roger.b.griffis@noaa.gov&gt;<br>&gt; Date: Wed, Mar 4, 2015 at 3:49 PM<br>&gt; Subject: Fwd: FINAL DRAFT of IWG-OSS Social Indicators Report for REVIEW:<br>> Comments Due COB March [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-04T18:05:47-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Patricia Clay - NOAA Federal</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;50239eb1.1503a</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;ef1aa7c2.1503a">   <title>Fwd: FINAL DRAFT of IWG-OSS Social Indicators Report for REVIEW: Comments Due COB March 27 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;ef1aa7c2.1503a</link>   <description> FYI, Trish Clay<br><br>---------- Forwarded message ----------<br>From: Roger Griffis - NOAA Federal &lt;roger.b.griffis@noaa.gov&gt;<br>Date: Wed, Mar 4, 2015 at 3:49 PM<br>Subject: Fwd: FINAL DRAFT of IWG-OSS Social Indicators Report for REVIEW:<br>Comments Due COB March 27<br><br>Hi folks -<br><br>Thought this might be of interest - feel free to review/respond as you see<br>fit. Thanks<br><br>Roger<br>---------- Forwarded message ----------<br>From: Tracy Rouleau - NOAA Federal &lt;tracy.rouleau@noaa.gov&gt;<br>Date: Tue, Mar 3, 2015 at 7:58 PM<br>Subject: FINAL DRAFT of IWG-OSS Social Indicators Report for REVIEW:<br>Comments Due COB March 27 [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-04T15:59:45-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Patricia Clay - NOAA Federal</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;ef1aa7c2.1503a</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;8e4c1955.1503a">   <title>Fwd: Internship Position Available at HRAF for Anthropology Students </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;8e4c1955.1503a</link>   <description> FYI, Trish Clay<br><br>---------- Forwarded message ----------<br>From: Human Relations Area Files (HRAF) at Yale University &lt;<br>christiane.cunnar@yale.edu&gt;<br>Date: Wed, Mar 4, 2015 at 1:41 PM<br>Subject: Internship Position Available at HRAF for Anthropology Students<br>To: patricia.m.clay@noaa.gov<br><br>Having trouble viewing this email? Click here<br>&lt;http://campaign.r20.constantcontact.com/render?ca=fc9a7816-74a4-4597-9c0f-803a7b1d069f&amp;c=813006f0-0450-11e3-9c85-d4ae5292c426&amp;ch=8132ed20-0450-11e3-9c85-d4ae5292c426&gt;<br>Please confirm<br>&lt;http://visitor.constantcontact.com/do?p=confirm&amp;m=001jXnGueBAQmHwmBEfMCOwfA%3D%3D&amp;ch=8132ed20-0450-11e3-9c85-d4ae5292c426&amp;ca=fc9a7816-74a4-4597-9c0f-803a7b1d069f&gt;<br>your continued interest in receiving email from us.<br><br>You may unsubscribe<br>&lt;http://visitor.constantcontact.com/do?p=un&amp;m=001jXnGueBAQmHwmBEfMCOwfA%3D%3D&amp;ch=8132ed20-0450-11e3-9c85-d4ae5292c426&amp;ca=fc9a7816-74a4-4597-9c0f-803a7b1d069f&gt;<br>if you no longer wish to receive our emails.<br>[image: Human Relations Area Files logo]<br>&lt;http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001i7Qr0tUyj29jnm01pewU--2gZFLVaBFvpQqWtLPBVwu9-qtc1usiPlc4IIAtO7xuQlO7NMYyh0VD-0qcGkKFe0xRwHuVDH4G747a4bYOxvULu6Sf5l7IyX9HoBEJkGun_RwDEVpbwg8c4p1-Z7O7NVKfzHoazC5ym2fRfEt_vLMyX9Ri5aJ9HMgC5HV_KNj_xCNYcJ6m7agTx1PI8Pi2uzVcDdDV5q0PODUQQP2yxQThRkNzC9-het5A4ZfC7trCLUHqpw5KUlAM_3IcxMVd4sggP6a0AFfz-f7xWqkq1Iwt8ErIPS2FRw==&amp;c=3Jkbzl-9dn9aL12WsQMGOjGYxaWIWBrFrNvm1Z1mAxXKFmz_XeqbDg==&amp;ch=6MA9uGP1kc1LJRKQiwSPg-wF4P_HchE_hLQzCPkVlm0ytjSQu-RjOw==&gt;<br>Internship Position at Human Relations Area Files [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-04T13:51:15-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Patricia Clay - NOAA Federal</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;8e4c1955.1503a</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;626c716a.1503a">   <title>CoGes Award </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;626c716a.1503a</link>   <description> Hello,<br><br>The AAA Committee on Gender Equity asked me to distribute the following<br>announcement.<br><br>015 CoGEA Award:<br><br>Nominations due: May1 to Suzanne Mattingly, CoGEA Liaison at<br>smattingly@aaanet.org<br><br>The CoGEA Award (formerly known as the Squeaky Wheel Award), sponsored by<br>the AAA Committee on Gender Equity in Anthropology (CoGEA), recognizes<br>individuals whose service to the discipline, and collective spirit of whose<br>research, teaching and mentoring, demonstrates the courage to bring to<br>light and investigate practices in anthropology that are potentially sexist<br>and discriminatory based on gender presentation. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-04T12:34:59-06:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ben Blount</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;626c716a.1503a</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;81e9a324.1502d">   <title>HRAF internship in Melvin Ember's honor </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;81e9a324.1502d</link>   <description> Dear SAS/SASci members,<br><br>This year (2014/15) was the first year that HRAF offered an internship in Melvin Ember's honor. We are offering the opportunity again for the upcoming year (2015/16) and we welcome applications. The intent of the internship is to learn about cross-cultural research and methods through practical experience. The internship carries a stipend to cover living expenses for almost a year. The position is ideal for graduating seniors who are interested in anthropology but want to take a year off before pursuing graduate work. See http://hraf.yale.edu/internships-at-hraf/ for more information and a printable pdf. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-25T20:59:28+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ember, Carol</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;81e9a324.1502d</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;fc665f7a.1502d">   <title>Methods Mall deadline March 1: NSF-supported courses on research methods </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;fc665f7a.1502d</link>   <description> The March 1 deadline for NSF-supported training programs is coming up in a<br>few days.<br><br>Go to &lt;http://qualquant.org/methodsmall/&gt; The Methods Mall for information<br>on National Science Foundation-supported methods courses for cultural<br>anthropologists.<br><br>Or read about the various programs below. scroll to see programs for<br>graduate students, for those with the ph.d., and for all anthropologists,<br>including undergraduates. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-24T17:09:30-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>H. Russell Bernard</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;fc665f7a.1502d</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;faf03055.1502d">   <title>Fw: congrats [ANTHRO-SCIENCES] SASci Election Results </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;faf03055.1502d</link>   <description> ----- Forwarded Message -----<br>From: Roland Alum &lt;ralum1@yahoo.com&gt;<br>To: Ben Blount &lt;ben.blount23@GMAIL.COM&gt;<br>Sent: Monday, February 23, 2015 1:45 PM<br>Subject: Re: congrats [ANTHRO-SCIENCES] SASci Election Results<br><br>congrats to those elected, another thankless job...<br><br>From: Ben Blount &lt;ben.blount23@GMAIL.COM&gt;<br>To: ANTHRO-SCIENCES@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Sent: Monday, February 23, 2015 1:10 PM<br>Subject: [ANTHRO-SCIENCES] SASci Election Results<br><br>Hello,<br>I am pleased to present the SASci Election Results.\ufffd\ufffd The successful candidates were:<br>President-Elect: Murray Leaf, University of Texas Dallas<br>Board Member: Stephen Chrisomails, Wayne State University<br>Secretary: Toni Copeland, Mississippi State University<br>Student Board Member: Wesley Allen-Arave, University of New Mexico<br>Congratulations to each, and thanks to [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-23T18:49:17+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Roland Alum</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;faf03055.1502d</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;7602f0fc.1502d">   <title>SASci Election Results </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;7602f0fc.1502d</link>   <description> Hello,<br><br>I am pleased to present the SASci Election Results. The successful<br>candidates were:<br><br>President-Elect: Murray Leaf, University of Texas Dallas<br><br>Board Member: Stephen Chrisomails, Wayne State University<br><br>Secretary: Toni Copeland, Mississippi State University<br><br>Student Board Member: Wesley Allen-Arave, University of New Mexico<br><br>Congratulations to each, and thanks to all SASci members who agreed to be<br>candidates.<br><br>The election winners will be the slate for the Society for Anthropological<br>Sciences in the upcoming AAA elections. Please vote. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-23T12:10:46-06:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ben Blount</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;7602f0fc.1502d</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;52b2f586.1502c">   <title>Proposal Deadlines AAA 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;52b2f586.1502c</link>   <description> Hello,<br><br>Just a reminder of deadlines for submission of proposals for the AAA 2015<br>meeting in Denver. Please consider submitting a proposal for a session or<br>a volunteered paper<br><br>*Deadline*<br><br>*Description*<br><br>January 15<br><br>Online abstract submission system opens for executive sessions only<br><br>February 17<br><br>Deadline for executive session proposals online *here*<br>&lt;https://aaa.confex.com/aaa/2015/sections.cgi&gt;<br><br>February 18<br><br>Online abstract submission system opens for all proposal types [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-16T16:46:02-06:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ben Blount</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;52b2f586.1502c</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;8cbe78b0.1502a">   <title>a beautiful essay on trying to reconcile anthropology and psychology in a war zone </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;8cbe78b0.1502a</link>   <description> Lydia Wilson's article in Nautilis on the very real problems of trying to reconcile anthropological filedwork and trying to test psychological theories at the same time, in a war zone. It is a deep, humorous, frustrating, sad and superbly written essay.<br><br>The ISIS in the room<br><br>http://nautil.us/issue/21/information/the-isis-in-the-room<br><br>----------------- Society for Anthropological Sciences ------------------ [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-07T06:19:19-08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Scott Atran</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;8cbe78b0.1502a</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;31924b32.1502a">   <title>A debate on the need for faith in human history, and now </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;31924b32.1502a</link>   <description> A debate on the role of faith in human history and now.<br><br>New Gods - Scott Atran, Simon Blackburn and Pavan Dhaliwal<br><br>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xomaqSOxZiU<br><br>----------------- Society for Anthropological Sciences ------------------<br><br>SASci Website: http://anthrosciences.org<br>SASci Wikid: http://anthrosciences.org/wikid<br><br>*** AAA Members - Join the Section for Anthropological Sciences when you renew your membership -<br>tick that box!   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-05T21:26:33-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Scott Atran</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;31924b32.1502a</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;f0d48414.1502a">   <title>Call for Papers, AAA 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;f0d48414.1502a</link>   <description> Fellow Sascians,<br><br>The call for papers at the Denver AAA Meetings in 2015 has been issued.<br><br>Call for Papers:<br>http://www.anthropology-news.org/index.php/2014/11/03/114th-aaa-annual-meeting-call-for-papers/<br><br>Session Types and Submission Information:<br>http://www.anthropology-news.org/index.php/2015/01/02/114th-annual-meeting-american-anthropological-association/<br><br>You might note that proposals for Executive Sessions are due February 2015,<br>and the must relate to the conference theme, Familiar/Strange. Invited<br>Session proposals are due April 15, and they no longer have to relate to<br>the theme, although the hope is that some of them will bear some<br>resemblance to the theme. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-05T14:38:54-06:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ben Blount</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;f0d48414.1502a</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;8a99959b.1502a">   <title>Re: RA2Scott: [ANTHRO-SCIENCES] Problems of Psychology and Anthropology : Nature News & Comment </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;8a99959b.1502a</link>   <description> Dear Scott, oncemore, you have \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdprovoked\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd another energetic debate.I always learn a lotfrom you and the exchanges.BTW, I can\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt rememberif I told you, but I taught in the Anthro. Dept. of John Jay College in theearly \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd80s [especially Legal Anthro.]\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdgreat, motivated students.\ufffd\ufffd I am still in touch w/ a few of them.\ufffd\ufffd One of them, whom I pushed to law school, becamea mayor in So. Fla.Congrats.\ufffd\ufffd Roland Armando Alum [NJ]<br>From: Scott Atran &lt;satran@UMICH.EDU&gt;<br>To: ANTHRO-SCIENCES@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Sent: Tuesday, January 27, 2015 9:27 PM<br>Subject: Re: [ANTHRO-SCIENCES] Problems of Psychology and Anthropology : Nature News &amp; Comment [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-03T02:39:27+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Roland Alum</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;8a99959b.1502a</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;cb20abd4.1501e">   <title>SASci election--Deadline February 6 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;cb20abd4.1501e</link>   <description> Dear SASci Members:<br><br>As you may recall, we hold a contested SASci election in the winter to choose SASci officers and board members. The President-Elect, Secretary, and Senior Board Member candidates are for the SASci elections and the winners (if AAA members) will be put up for the AAA SAS section positions. The SASci Board does not have student board members, but the purpose of the ballot for the Student Board is to select a single candidate for the upcoming AAA elections to be held in May 2015. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-30T01:08:30+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ember, Carol</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANTHRO-SCIENCES;cb20abd4.1501e</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
